summary: The Methane Emissions Reduction Program Clarifications Act of 2025 amends the Clean Air Act to modify the Methane Emissions Reduction Program. Key provisions include exemptions for small upstream producers and certain producers complying with existing regulations. It mandates a public comment period for related regulations, establishes a dispute resolution process, and sets a sunset date for the program. The bill also requires the EPA to publish detailed information on calculation methods and consult with facility operators in developing documentation.
